timeline.author: cpmeister

timeline.bodyText: should "id" and "identifier" be included in the prop order?
timeline.author: cpmeister

replies.bodyText:
First of all no, because propOrder specifies the order for XML Schema elements when class is mapped to a XML Schema and "id" and "identifier" are attributes.
But that makes me wonder why I need it at all. I do not write XML. I will try to remove it.
replies.author: cweitkamp

replies.bodyText: Gah, you are right. It has been too long since I used the xml annotations. 😄
replies.author: cpmeister

timeline.bodyText:
I tried to make this logic more readable.

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                    ButtonModel lastPressedButton = shortPressButton != null
          
          
            
                            ? (longPressButton != null
          
          
            
                                    ? (shortPressButton.getLastpressedtimestamp() > longPressButton.getLastpressedtimestamp()
          
          
            
                                            ? shortPressButton
          
          
            
                                            : longPressButton)
          
          
            
                                    : shortPressButton)
          
          
            
                            : longPressButton;
          
          
            
                    ButtonModel lastPressedButton = (shortPressButton != null && (longPressButton == null || shortPressButton.getLastpressedtimestamp() > longPressButton.getLastpressedtimestamp()))
          
          
            
                            ? shortPressButton
          
          
            
                            : longPressButton;
timeline.author: cpmeister

timeline.message:
Incorporated comments from review

Signed-off-by: Christoph Weitkamp <github@christophweitkamp.de>

timeline.bodyText: If you override equals you need to also override hashCode as per the general contract: Any two equal objects must also have equal hashcodes.
timeline.author: cpmeister

replies.bodyText: Yes, thanks for the hint. I implemented hashCode() and improved equals().
replies.author: cweitkamp
